result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: for Extension of Time to File Motions to Suppress filed by Atty Schmeiser
Return date 1-26-23 at 9:00 AM

3:36 PM Cases called: 22CF263, 22TR2919-22TR2923 & 22TR3184-22TR3192 will continue to track with 22CF263. Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael P North in court.  Attorney Sarah M Schmeiser in court for Michael P North. State called witness; Deputy T. Lange of Columbia County Sheriff's Office, sworn. Direct exam. Cross exam. Witness excused. Closing argument by State. Court found probable cause, bound the defendant over for further proceedings. Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea.  Bond continued. 3:48 PM
Return date scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 09:00 am.
